Issue Title: Switch the package version loading order of package.json/composer.json
Author: andytom
Comment Body: I think your suggestion makes sense to me but I'm neither a PHP or JS developer so maybe there are contradicting arguments that I'm not aware of.

Issue Title: Switch the package version loading order of package.json/composer.json
Author: micc83
Comment Body: Moreover, when `package.json` is used (in a mixed language project) by the bundler the package is usually marked as private (I see that at the moment Starship doesn't show the version for a private `package.json` file). My first idea was indeed to simply skip it when marked as private but  I guess adding the check only for  `package.json`  would probably lead to some inconsistencies.

Issue Title: Switch the package version loading order of package.json/composer.json
Author: andytom
Comment Body: I think this might be fixed by #2959, at least in the case of a private version in a `package.json` in a mixed language projects.

Issue Title: Switch the package version loading order of package.json/composer.json
Author: micc83
Comment Body:
> I think this might be fixed by #2959, at least in the case of a private version in a `package.json` in a mixed language projects.

I guess so. I'll check it out as soon as it'll be released.

Issue Title: Switch the package version loading order of package.json/composer.json
Author: Kissaki
Comment Body:
[@andytom comment](https://github.com/starship/starship/issues/1631#issuecomment-892986126) suggests this has been resolved. Is that the case, or is this still open?

@micc83 did you have a chance to look into that?

Issue Title: Switch the package version loading order of package.json/composer.json
Author: micc83
Comment Body: @Kissaki I confirm that now when `package.json` is set to private `composer.json` version is picked instead. Thank you and @andytom for the PR.

Issue Title: Switch the package version loading order of package.json/composer.json
Author: niklasschaeffer
Comment Body:
Well Just now i stumble upon this issue when i was searching why my package.json version number would not show up at all in starship. Now that im reading this conversion im very surprised. In my eyes it literally makes zero sense to hide a version because it has been defined as private for the npm registry. Like why would you do that ? I want as much information out of my console as possible and this is just very hindering. Also i don't see sense in the argumentation. 

1. JS Projects: Never seen a JS project with a composer.json file in the root (There might be some edge cases I might not be aware of);

- Wrong! I know of a lot of projects which have a composer.json as well.

2. PHP Projects: Many of the most prominent PHP frameworks ([Laravel](https://github.com/laravel/laravel)/[Symfony](https://github.com/symfony/symfony)), but also packages that provides a Web UI, have a package.json file in their root to handle assets bundling.

- Yes! That is true.

3. So the point here is that while the first case is unlikely in the second one you'd probably be more interested in the PHP package version that the one of the JS bundler (which, by the way, is usually set to private).

- WRONG! It does not mean you are not interested in the Js Version. Im a Frontend-Developer working in PHP Focused Project. 

Please revert this offending and by the way very stupid line of code.

https://github.com/starship/starship/blob/567ea8d2be63475841d2fe74985dbdc15d286846/src/modules/package.rs#L169

Issue Title: custom format hide part completely if empty
Author: lachieh
Comment Body:
This is already possible with [conditional format strings](https://starship.rs/config/#conditional-format-strings) since they work across multiple lines:

```toml
format = """
$directory\
(\
[ > ](fg:color_aqua)\
$git_branch\
$git_status\
)\
$line_break$character"""
```

In this case, if all of the variables inside the section are empty, the rest of the content inside the open/close parentheses will not show:

```
~/projects/somegitrepo > main [!]
$ cd ..
~/projects
$ 
```

Issue Title: custom format hide part completely if empty
Author: mirsella
Comment Body: honestly i dont even remember for what case i wanted to do this. thanks for the answer

Issue Title: unable to find '/tmp/.psub.yer5XsVh3Ysource'
Author: davidkna
Comment Body: Something about this set-up appears to break `psub` which is used by starship during fish init. `starship init fish --print-full-init | source` should work.

Issue Title: unable to find '/tmp/.psub.yer5XsVh3Ysource'
Author: rafaScalet
Comment Body: @davidkna, that works, thank you very much, i have this issue for so long time

Issue Title: Right prompt time only on last command
Author: davidkna
Comment Body: Please try adding `hide-env TRANSIENT_PROMPT_COMMAND_RIGHT` to your nu config. Nushell seems to default to `TRANSIENT_PROMPT_COMMAND_RIGHT=""` now.

Issue Title: Right prompt time only on last command
Author: dougg0k
Comment Body: That was the solution, thanks.

Issue Title: hostname is automatically converted to uppercase (v1.21.1)
Author: davidkna
Comment Body: https://github.com/starship/starship/pull/6343 includes a fix for this issue by using a different function in `whoami`on Windows.

Issue Title: hostname is automatically converted to uppercase (v1.21.1)
Author: meop
Comment Body:
> [ardaku/whoami#121](https://github.com/ardaku/whoami/issues/121)

Looks like Starship fixed this on their side by flipping the whoami functions called.
But in the whoami bug I had put forth an argument that whoami should fix it by flipping its own functions behavior.
If whoami does fix the bug on their side, then you would have to revisit this and revert this change.

Issue Title: cmd.exe Starship not starting. Error: AppData\Local\clink\starship.lua:1: attempt to call a nil value

Comment Body: I figured out that a reg entry in Command Processor\AutoRun interfered with clink loading the lua.

Issue Title: cmd.exe Starship not starting. Error: AppData\Local\clink\starship.lua:1: attempt to call a nil value
Author: JustJace1
Comment Body: having this same could you explain how to fix it

Issue Title: cmd.exe Starship not starting. Error: AppData\Local\clink\starship.lua:1: attempt to call a nil value
Author: n0valis
Comment Body:
I had an entry in the above mentioned registry key for loading my alias file upon shell opening.
Removing that entry fixed it for me.

Issue Title: Failed to detect Linux OS

Comment Body: Seems like starship thinks you're using Rocky Linux. Can you maybe share the output of `cat /etc/os-release`?

Comment Body:
I have mentioned that I use Ubuntu 24.04 but sure here the output

```
cat /etc/os-release

PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 24.04 LTS"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION_ID="24.04"
VERSION="24.04 LTS (Noble Numbat)"
VERSION_CODENAME=noble
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/"
```

Issue Title: Failed to detect Linux OS
Author: RasheedAZ
Comment Body: Hi. Not sure if I should create a separate issue or not - I have a similar issue. The install script tries to download the wrong package `starship-x86_64-unknown-linux-musl.tar.gz` although I'm on Pop!_OS 22.04 so it should be downloading `starship-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu.tar.gz` right?

Issue Title: Failed to detect Linux OS
Author: davidkna
Comment Body: @RasheedAZ The static musl build is always preferred over glibc to avoid potential libc-versioning issues.

Issue Title: Failed to detect Linux OS
Author: marleau
Comment Body:
I'm also seeing this error. Starship thinks I'm running Rocky, but I'm running Debian.

Here is the output of `cat /etc/os-release`:

```
PRETTY_NAME="Debian GNU/Linux 12 (bookworm)"
NAME="Debian GNU/Linux"
VERSION_ID="12"
VERSION="12 (bookworm)"
VERSION_CODENAME=bookworm
ID=debian
HOME_URL="https://www.debian.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://www.debian.org/support"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.debian.org/"
```

Issue Title: Failed to detect Linux OS
Author: marleau
Comment Body:
Did a little more digging.

Seems like when I generated my config, the `starship preset plain-text-symbols` command  generated the `.toml` file with `Rocky` instead of `RockyLinux` as reflected in this PR #5849.

Just checked the latest version and the output of `starship preset plain-text-symbols` is correct.

So I think this issue can be closed.

Issue Title: "disable all by default" setting
Author: davidkna
Comment Body:
Thanks for the report, as a workaround you can use the top-level format.
Since this has been requested before, and to keep discussion in one place, I am closing this in favor of #4312.

Issue Title: "disable all by default" setting
Author: ctcjab
Comment Body:
Sorry I missed #4312 before opening this!

> as a workaround you can use the top-level format

Can you show an example of how to do this please, either here or in #4312 or in the docs? I checked https://starship.rs/config/ and didn't see how you can use top-level format to disable all but the desired plugins.

Thanks for maintaining Starship!

Issue Title: "disable all by default" setting
Author: davidkna
Comment Body: E.g. setting the top-level `format` to `$directory$rust$package` will only use the directory, rust and package modules in the prompt.

Issue Title: Trojan:Script/Wacatac.B!ml detected in starship-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc.zip (v1.22.1)
Author: matchai
Comment Body:
Hey @pszlazak, thanks for the heads up!

I've submitted all three Windows .zip builds to Microsoft Security Intelligence as false positives. Surprisingly, none of the .msi builds are flagged as malware.

Usually this gets addressed my Microsoft within a couple days. Hopefully it gets seen quickly this time around 👍

I'll keep this issue open and updated with any news that comes from Microsoft about these reports.

Issue Title: Trojan:Script/Wacatac.B!ml detected in starship-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc.zip (v1.22.1)
